senses.definition: to apply to somebody/something

senses.definition: to happen in a particular way

a joint account (= one in the name of more than one person)
With internet banking you can manage your account online.
Do you have an account with us?

What's your account number please?

senses.definition: an arrangement that somebody has with a company that allows them to use the internet, send and receive messages by email, social media, etc.

examples.x: an email/Instagram account

senses.definition: a written or spoken description of something that has happened report

examples.x: an eyewitness account (= a description given by somebody who saw what happened)
a first-hand/personal/first-person account

senses.definition: an explanation or a description of an idea, a theory or a process

examples.x: the Biblical account of the creation of the world

senses.definition: a written record of money that is owed to a business and of money that has been paid by it

examples.x: to do the accounts
to keep the accounts up to date
the accounts department
She works in Accounts (= the accounts department).

senses.definition: an arrangement with a shop or business to pay bills for goods or services at a later time, for example in regular amounts every month bill

examples.x: Put it on my account please.

Log in to your account to see how much you have spent.

senses.definition: a bill for goods or services provided over a period

examples.x: Departing guests should settle their accounts at the office.
It is best to settle the account each month.

senses.definition: a regular customer

examples.x: The agency has lost several of its most important accounts.

senses.definition: a possibility of something happening, especially something that you want

examples.x: She only has a slim chance of passing the exam.

senses.definition: a suitable time or situation when you have the opportunity to do something

examples.cf: chance for somebody to do something
examples.x: There will be a chance for parents to look around the school.

senses.definition: an unpleasant or dangerous possibility

examples.x: When installing electrical equipment don't take any chances. A mistake could kill.

senses.definition: the way that some things happen without any cause that you can see or understand luck

examples.x: I met her by chance (= without planning to) at the airport.

senses.definition: something that you imagine; your imagination

examples.x: night-time fancies that disappear in the morning
a child’s wild flights of fancy

senses.definition: a feeling that you would like to have or to do something

examples.x: She said she wanted a dog but it was only a passing fancy.

senses.definition: a small decorated cake
to start not liking somebody/something for no clear reason
the bright quality that something has when light is reflected on it

examples.x: a shampoo that gives your hair body and shine
the shine of polished wood

senses.definition: the act of thinking carefully about something

examples.x: An employer is legally bound to give due consideration to the request.

senses.definition: something that must be thought about when you are planning or deciding something

examples.x: The government's decision was obviously motivated by political considerations.
economic/commercial/environmental/practical considerations

senses.definition: the quality of being sensitive towards others and thinking about their wishes and feelings

senses.definition: a reward or payment for a service

examples.x: You can buy the books for a small consideration.

senses.definition: advice

examples.x: the University Advisement Center

senses.definition: to go away to a place, especially to escape from danger

examples.x: The rebels took to the hills.

senses.definition: to begin to do something as a habit

examples.x: I've taken to waking up very early.

senses.definition: to develop an ability for something

senses.definition: the particular quality that different foods and drinks have that allows you to recognize them when you put them in your mouth

examples.x: a sweet/salty/bitter/sour taste

senses.definition: the sense you have that allows you to recognize different foods and drinks when you put them in your mouth

examples.x: I've lost my sense of taste.

senses.definition: a small quantity of food or drink that you try in order to see what it is like

examples.x: Just have a taste of this cheese.

senses.definition: a short experience of something

examples.x: This was my first taste of live theatre.

senses.definition: a person’s ability to choose things that people recognize as being of good quality or appropriate

examples.x: He has very good taste in music.

senses.definition: what a person likes or prefers

examples.x: You can adapt the recipe to suit your personal taste.

to develop/acquire a taste for luxury

senses.definition: used for referring to a person or thing that is not near the speaker, or not as near to the speaker as another

examples.x: Who's that?

Those look riper than these.

senses.definition: used for referring to somebody/something that has already been mentioned, or is already known about

examples.x: What can I do about that?

senses.definition: used for referring to people or things of a particular type

examples.x: Those present were in favour of change.

senses.definition: used as a relative pronoun to introduce a part of a sentence which refers to the person, thing or time you have been talking about that

examples.x: Where's the letter that came yesterday?
Who was it that won the US Open?
The watch (that) you gave me keeps perfect time.

senses.definition: not as great in size, amount or importance as something/somebody else

senses.definition: used in the names of some types of animals, birds and plants that are smaller than similar kinds

examples.x: a lesser black-backed gull

senses.definition: to consider something carefully, especially before reaching a decision

examples.x: He'd like more time to think things over.

senses.definition: to have a particular idea or opinion about something/somebody; to believe something think

examples.x: Do you really think (that) he'll win?
I thought I heard a scream.
I didn't think people were allowed to park here.

I think this is their house, but I'm not sure.

Well, I like it. What do you think?

What did you think of the film?
‘Is he any good?’ ‘I don't think so.’
‘Will we make it in time?’ ‘I think so.’

It was better than I thought possible.

I think of this place as my home.

senses.definition: to use your mind to consider something, to form connected ideas, to try to solve problems, etc.

examples.x: Are animals able to think?

All he ever thinks about is money.

senses.definition: to have ideas, words or images in your mind

examples.x: You're very quiet. What are you thinking?

senses.definition: to form an idea of something; to imagine something imagine

examples.x: We couldn't think where you'd gone.

senses.definition: to expect something

senses.definition: to think in a particular way or on a particular subject

examples.x: Let's think positive.

senses.definition: used in questions to show that you are angry or surprised

senses.definition: used to make something you say sound less definite or more polite

examples.x: I thought we could go out tonight.

senses.definition: to remember something; to have something come into your mind

senses.definition: a situation in which either of two choices, results, etc. is equally possible

examples.x: ‘Have you decided on the colour yet?’ ‘It's a toss-up between the blue and the green.’

senses.definition: a person who is determined and not easily frightened
a very difficult choice or question
if a decision or an opinion is unanimous, it is agreed or shared by everyone in a group unanimous

examples.x: a unanimous vote
unanimous support

senses.definition: not having made a decision about somebody/something

senses.definition: not having been decided

senses.definition: to support something that you think is right and make sure that it continues to exist

senses.definition: to agree that a previous decision was correct or that a request is reasonable

senses.definition: a decision that you make or an opinion that you give about something, after you have tested it or considered it carefully

examples.x: Well, what's your verdict?

senses.definition: used to show that two teams or sides are against each other

examples.x: It is France versus Brazil in the final.

senses.definition: used to compare two different ideas, choices, etc.

senses.definition: the right to refuse to allow something to be done, especially the right to stop a law from being passed or a decision from being taken

senses.definition: an occasion when somebody refuses to allow something to be done

senses.definition: the power to choose something freely or to make your own decisions

senses.definition: the total number of votes in an election

senses.definition: the vote given by a particular group of people, or for a particular party, etc.

examples.x: the student vote

senses.definition: to choose somebody/something for a position or an award by voting

examples.x: He was voted most promising new director.

senses.definition: to say that something is good or bad

senses.definition: to agree to give somebody/yourself something by voting

examples.x: The directors have just voted themselves a huge pay increase.

senses.definition: to suggest something or support a suggestion that somebody has made

examples.x: I vote (that) we go out to eat.

senses.definition: to begin to like somebody

examples.x: I warmed to her immediately.

senses.definition: to begin to like somebody

examples.x: I warmed to her immediately.

senses.definition: to be or become weak or unsteady

examples.x: His voice wavered with emotion.

senses.definition: to hesitate and be unable to make a decision or choice

senses.definition: to move in an unsteady way
a person who is unable to make a decision or choice

examples.x: The strength of his argument convinced the waverers.

senses.definition: to have a particular weight

senses.definition: to measure how heavy somebody/something is, usually by using scales

examples.x: He weighed himself on the bathroom scales.

senses.definition: to consider something carefully before making a decision

senses.definition: to have an influence on somebody’s opinion or the result of something

senses.definition: to lift an anchor out of the water and into a boat before sailing away
an act of pushing something/somebody

examples.x: She gave him a gentle push.
The car won't start. Can you give it a push?

senses.definition: a large and determined military attack

examples.x: a final push against the enemy

senses.definition: a determined effort to achieve something

examples.x: The push for reform started in 2007.

senses.definition: an act of encouraging somebody to do something

examples.x: He wants to open his own business, but needs a push in the right direction to get him started.

senses.definition: used to express a doubt or choice between two possibilities weather

examples.x: He seemed undecided whether to go or stay.

senses.definition: used in polite offers or invitations

examples.x: Would you like a sandwich?

senses.definition: used to say what you like, love, hate, etc.

examples.cf: would like, love, hate, prefer, etc. something
examples.x: I'd love a coffee.

examples.cf: would like, etc. to do something
examples.x: I'd be only too glad to help.

examples.cf: would like, etc. somebody to do something
examples.x: I'd hate you to think I was criticizing you.
I'd rather come with you.

senses.definition: used as the past form of will when reporting what somebody has said or thought

examples.cf: in order that somebody/something would do something
examples.x: He worked hard in order that he would pass all his exams.

senses.definition: used for saying what you want to happen

examples.x: I wish that you'd be quiet for a minute.

senses.definition: used to show that somebody/something was not willing or refused to do something

examples.x: She wouldn't change it, even though she knew it was wrong.

senses.definition: used to ask somebody politely to do something

senses.definition: used to give opinions that you are not certain about

examples.x: I would imagine the job will take about two days.

senses.definition: used to give advice

examples.x: I wouldn't have any more to drink, if I were you.

senses.definition: used for talking about things that often happened in the past

examples.x: When my parents were away, my grandmother would take care of me.

senses.definition: used for talking about behaviour that you think is typical

examples.x: ‘She said it was your fault.’ ‘Well, she would say that, wouldn't she? She's never liked me.’

senses.definition: used to express a strong wish modal verbs

examples.x: Would that he had lived to see it.

senses.definition: used to mean ‘fairly’ or ‘to some degree’, often when you are disappointed, surprised or expressing slight criticism Quite

examples.x: rather odd/strange/unusual
a rather large sum of money
A rather small number of people turned up.

I thought it was a rather good idea.

senses.definition: used with a verb to make a statement sound less strong

senses.definition: used to correct something you have said, or to give more accurate information i.e.

examples.x: She worked as a secretary, or rather, a personal assistant.

senses.definition: used to introduce an idea that is different or opposite to the idea that you have stated previously

examples.x: The walls were not white, but rather a sort of dirty grey.
